nodes.bodyText:
Antora needs to run from a git repo, but if you want to spare yourself the need to do git init you can change this to
content:
    sources:
        - url: ../../..
          start_path: documentation/target/antora
          branches: HEAD                    

and it will reuse the existing git repo

@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@

+site:
+    title: SmallRye Reactive Messaging Documentation
+    start_page: smallrye-reactive-messaging::index.adoc
+content:
+    sources:
+        - url: ./

nodes.bodyText:
Does this need to be a variable? I mean, even if your project.version is for example 1.3.5-SNAPSHOT, the "documentation version" will probably be 1.3 (we will not produce a different doc version for each micro release or so)
What I was expecting to do with this is that we simply put in the major.minor version here and update it manually once in a while (which will basically be only when you create a new branch targeting a different minor version, so not very often)

I caught it yesterday. I missed it.
The issue is that it avoids the release process automation without adding a commit in the process. Adding a commit is not impossible, just tricky as I will rely on regexp and replacement.
Note that most of the time we are releasing minor, so it would require an increment every time (more or less).
I found a way to extract this in Maven.
